title: Rear Wheel Needle Roller Bearing - Lubricate

body.body: Rear Wheel Needle Roller Bearing - Lubricate
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Loosen the rear wheel spindle bolt.
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle until the rear wheel is off the ground.
Remove the rear wheel spindle bolt.
Release the fixings and remove the rear bevel box badge. Discard the fixings.
Remove the bearing sleeve and oil seal.
Coat the needle rollers with Castrol grease. Make sure the needle rollers turn so that the grease is distributed over the entire circumference of the internal parts.
Check the condition of the oil seal, replace if necessary, and fit to the rear bevel box.
Fit the rear bevel box finisher and tighten its new fixings to
Fit the rear wheel spindle bolt.
Lower the motorcycle to the ground.
